meanings.definition: To surpass in counting or enumeration.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outcount her classmates in math competitions.
meanings.sent2: He can outcount anyone in the room when it comes to remembering phone numbers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outcount the birds in the park, but they were too quick for him.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcount others is like a superpower in the world of puzzles and riddles.
meanings.sent5: Outcounting the opponent in chess requires strategic thinking and patience.

meanings.definition: To count more than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: I always outcount my brother when we play the counting game.
meanings.sent2: The diligent cashier can outcount the other employees in the store.
meanings.sent3: The race to outcount the number of candies in the jar was intense at the school fair.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to outcount the raindrops falling on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The child's excitement outcounted his tiredness as he played with his new toy.
